review.title: Dynamics of core of language vocabulary
review.abstract: Studies of the overall structure of vocabulary and its dynamics became possible due to creation of diachronic text corpora, especially Google Books Ngram. This article discusses the question of core change rate and the degree to which the core words cover the texts. Different periods of the last three centuries and six main European languages presented in Google Books Ngram are compared. The main result is high stability of core change rate, which is analogous to stability of the Swadesh list.
histories: This report was presented at the Workshop "Computational linguistics and language science", Moscow, Russia on April 25, 2016

metadata.title: Dynamics of core of language vocabulary

sections.text: diachronic text corpora, in particular Google Books Ngram. This article discusses the issue of the core change rate and the degree to which the core words cover the texts. It compares different periods of the last three centuries and six major European languages represented in Google Books Ngram. The main result is a high stability of the core change rate analogous to the stability of the Swadesh listing. Keywords: core vocabulary, language dynamics, Google Books Ngram

sections.heading: 1 Introduction
sections.text: In this paper, we examine the dynamics of the overall structure of the language vocabulary from an active point of view. Traditionally, two components of the language vocabulary are distinguished: the center and the periphery. The former contains highly stable words of maximum frequency (go, read, etc.) and provides stability in the language; the periphery contains the words that are obsolete or, on the contrary, they have just appeared in the language, guaranteeing greater flexibility. We will present some quantitative characteristics of the dynamics of the center. To do this, we should answer the following questions: How to determine the core?

sections.heading: 2 Rate of change of the core
sections.text: Of course, taking into account the rate of change of the core, this does not mean that these words occur only in a certain period of time.

sections.heading: 3 Degree of covering of texts by the core
sections.text: The most important characteristics of the core words are the extent to which they are effective for communication. Formally, this can be represented by the percentage of the core words in the texts, i.e. by the degree to which the core words comprise these texts. Let us now analyze the change in the total frequency of words in these words. If we look at the core for the language state in 1800 (for greater stability in the calculations), we take the interval 1795-1805 and define the core window. For a 1000-word core, the total frequency falls in about 0.7 to 0.6 years.

sections.heading: 4 Conclusion
sections.text: In the article, the structure of the lexicon is considered from a cognitive point of view and distinguishes between the center (core - the most commonly used lexicon axis) and the periphery; the core size is evaluated differently in different essays - from 1 to 8,000 words; in our work, the calculations for all core sizes in this area are performed; the core change data is presented for the first time; it turns out that the core has changed steadily over the last 300 years - about 15% of the words are replaced every 50 years; the result is obtained for different languages (presented in Google Books Ngram) and is to some extent analogous to the results that Swodesh has obtained in terms of the stability of the words from its list; the size of the texts covered by the core words is counted (or the total frequency of the core words); it has been found that the core effect cannot only be explained by core words obsolescence (removal from the core), i.e. by updating, but also by extending the lexicon's expressive possibilities.
